availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Garland Carter (Louisville Dry Goods Merchant)

body.p: Native of Simpson County, Kentucky. Worked as a dry goods merchant in Louisville. Active member of the Methodist faith.

Spouse: Melvilla Carter
Children: Edwin L. Carter, Allen R. Carter, James G. Carter Jr.,

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, page 53.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, page 45.
The Courier Journal, "Merchant and Christian," December 18, 1889, page 6.

Kentucky Find a Grave Index, "James Garland Carter Sr.," https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=CART&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=2361&GRid=83020668& accessed 05/11/2017.
